p: CHIKV infections in Brazil accounted for 277,882 and 185,593 suspected cases in 2016 and 2017, respectively [ 22]. In 2018, the country registered 87,687 suspected cases, most of which in south-eastern Brazil (52,966; 60.4%) [ 4]. In 2016, Rio de Janeiro state reported 18,516 CHIKV suspected cases until epidemiological week 52 [ 22]. The epidemic persisted and, in 2018, Rio de Janeiro state reported 39,725 cases, with the municipalities of Rio de Janeiro (10,062 cases) and São Gonçalo (6,261 cases) municipalities being among the most affected by the epidemic [ 4].
